
<table><thead><tr><th>

Method


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

[$where(this, argument)](./goosetyped.modelextensions._where.md)


</td><td>

Adds a `$where` clause to this query


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[aggregate(this, pipeline, options)](./goosetyped.modelextensions.aggregate.md)


</td><td>


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[aggregate(this, pipeline)](./goosetyped.modelextensions.aggregate_1.md)


</td><td>


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[bulkSave(this, documents, options)](./goosetyped.modelextensions.bulksave.md)


</td><td>

Sends multiple `save()` calls in a single `bulkWrite()`<!-- -->. This is faster than sending multiple `save()` calls because with `bulkSave()` there is only one network round trip to the MongoDB server.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[bulkWrite(this, writes, options)](./goosetyped.modelextensions.bulkwrite.md)


</td><td>

Sends multiple `insertOne`<!-- -->, `updateOne`<!-- -->, `updateMany`<!-- -->, `replaceOne`<!-- -->, `deleteOne`<!-- -->, and/or `deleteMany` operations to the MongoDB server in one command. This is faster than sending multiple independent operations (e.g. if you use `create()`<!-- -->) because with `bulkWrite()` there is only one network round trip to the MongoDB server.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[bulkWrite(this, writes, options)](./goosetyped.modelextensions.bulkwrite_1.md)


</td><td>


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[countDocuments(this, filter, options)](./goosetyped.modelextensions.countdocuments.md)


</td><td>

Creates a `countDocuments` query: counts the number of documents that match `filter`<!-- -->.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[create(this, docs, options)](./goosetyped.modelextensions.create.md)


</td><td>


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[create(this, docs, options)](./goosetyped.modelextensions.create_1.md)


</td><td>


</td></tr>

[create(this, doc1, doc2, docs)](./goosetyped.modelextensions.create_3.md)


</td><td>


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[createCollection(this, options)](./goosetyped.modelextensions.createcollection.md)


</td><td>

Create the collection for this model. By default, if no indexes are specified, mongoose will not create the collection for the model until any documents are created. Use this method to create the collection explicitly.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[createSearchIndex(this, description)](./goosetyped.modelextensions.createsearchindex.md)


</td><td>

Create an \[Atlas search index\](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/atlas-search/create-index/). This function only works when connected to MongoDB Atlas.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[ctor(this, doc)](./goosetyped.modelextensions.ctor.md)


</td><td>

Like `create()` but without the save, replaces the constructor. Useful when you want to create a new instance from a base discriminator class


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[deleteMany(this, filter, options)](./goosetyped.modelextensions.deletemany.md)


</td><td>

Deletes all of the documents that match `conditions` from the collection. Behaves like `remove()`<!-- -->, but deletes all documents that match `conditions` regardless of the `single` option.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[deleteMany(this, filter)](./goosetyped.modelextensions.deletemany_1.md)


</td><td>


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[deleteOne(this, filter, options)](./goosetyped.modelextensions.deleteone.md)


</td><td>

Deletes the first document that matches `conditions` from the collection. Behaves like `remove()`<!-- -->, but deletes at most one document regardless of the `single` option.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[deleteOne(this, filter)](./goosetyped.modelextensions.deleteone_1.md)


</td><td>


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[dropSearchIndex(this, name)](./goosetyped.modelextensions.dropsearchindex.md)


</td><td>

Delete an existing \[Atlas search index\](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/atlas-search/create-index/) by name. This function only works when connected to MongoDB Atlas.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[find(this, filter, projection, options)](./goosetyped.modelextensions.find.md)


</td><td>

Creates a `find` query: gets a list of documents that match `filter`<!-- -->.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[find(this, filter, projection, options)](./goosetyped.modelextensions.find_1.md)

</td><td>


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[findById(this, id, projection, options)](./goosetyped.modelextensions.findbyid.md)


</td><td>

Finds a single document by its \_id field. `findById(id)` is almost\* equivalent to `findOne({ _id: id })`<!-- -->. If you want to query by a document's `_id`<!-- -->, use `findById()` instead of `findOne()`<!-- -->.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[findById(this, id, projection, options)](./goosetyped.modelextensions.findbyid_1.md)


</td><td>
